articles.content:
The queue for a recycling facility in Belfast started at 7am on Monday as Northern Ireland took its first steps out of the coronavirus lockdown. 
Ken Mills was first in line for Palmerston Recycling Centre as a queue of cars stretched along the Holywood Road… [+3267 chars]

articles.author: Daniel Morrow
articles.title: Unknown number of residents die at Aberdeenshire care home hit by Covid-19 - Daily Record
articles.description: Care firm Barchester, which oversees the operations of Kirkburn Court in Peterhead, confirmed that an unknown number of residents have also tested positive for Covid-19.
articles.content:
A number of residents at an Aberdeenshire care home have died following an outbreak of coronavirus. 
 Residents at the Kirkburn Court facility in Peterhead tested positive for Covid-19 according to the companys operator Barchester.

articles.title: Duchess of Cambridge: 'If someone you know is acting differently, message them now' - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Keep checking in with friends and family in case they're struggling under the coronavirus pandemic, William and Kate say
articles.content:
If a friend or relative is acting differently, message them now, the Duchess of Cambridge has urged. 
The Duchess said it is ok to ask how people are and encourage them to talk, as they struggle with their mental health under the coronavirus pandemic.
Speak… [+836 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus updates: Northern Ireland takes first steps out of lockdown - Belfast Telegraph
articles.description: The Executive has implemented further easing of the coronavirus lockdown measures allowing bigger outdoor gatherings, private worship in churches and golf courses to open.
articles.content:

articles.description: All the latest news and updates.
articles.content:
Coronavirus testing continues across the UK (Picture: PA)
Another 160 people have died of Covid-19 across the UK, bringing the death toll to 34,796.
